creator: bugzilla@l-i-e.com
text:
It would be Really Nifty (tm) if the default MSI installer would add -E
~/logs/error_log to its service and monitor startup parameters, so that when
users add modules or edit httpd.conf in other ways, they can get some feedback
on their problems.

For example, messed up permissions on DLLs for modules such as PHP will generate
no useful info unless one does this.

Or, at least, I was only able to figure out what was wrong with the permissions
with this...

It doesn't seem like -E logging would impact performance, as it occurs at
startup, and would get rid of a few bogus bug reports, for those users who DO
look at log files to try to find out what went wrong.
:-)

PS
Sending the errors to the Windows Event log as well would also be Nifty, for
those users who check there first...

The really WEIRD thing is that Windoze claims my System event log is corrupted.
Unless I am editing it in PFE (a text editor) and then it doesn't.
I don't even want to know how they managed to write code that did that...

The Windows Event log is used to collect these events by-default.  I don't really
see an advantage to the proposal (incidently, I implemented -E).

-E is an alternative you are welcome to use...

httpd -k config -n servicename [more parameters]

including -E will let you vary this behavior itself.  While httpd users are very
familiar with looking in the error log, most incoming windows users don't even
know it exists - they are familiar with the event log.

As far as your corrupt system - ugh.  Good luck with that.

I'll leave this open to see if others weight in.  I'm glad the feature helped
you in spite of a terribly borked OS install.
creator: wrowe@apache.org

text: Since there was no further feedback, closing.
